column5: Hi all,  Cant believe that this is only my second time out ice fishing this year apart from a few brief half hearted attempts at the ice shack.  Weather felt like summer….a balmy -20C, but no wind. Got chillier later when a 10kmh wind whipped up from the SWest.  35' to 40' FOW.  1.5" white/pearl YUM LPT tubes on 1/8th Oz jigs.  Fish were finicky but every now and then an unstoppable freight train would smash the mini tube. When you saw it coming you had to hold the bait still or it would pull out of the attack and head back to the bottom, they did not want to chase at all today.  No trout today, but we'll be back for sure.  I ended up with 8 on the ice,  about the same got off. Just what the doctor ordered after such a long time off the ice.   (best when HD is selected)
That has to be fun!!! Good fishing!!
Be lots of fat / blood line trimming on those buggers! Great stuff Simon!
Yup lots of trimming to do. But. Worth it once the Mediterranean shrimp and whitefish hotpot is done.
nice you have enough fish there to feed a small country lol
Those are some dandy's................I got 2,on Lac Seul a few years ago (about that size) they fight like crazy. Thanks for the report.
I could use one of those days!  Good fishing Simon!!
Nice fish simon! At least someone is catchin lol, i got 2 skunks in a row now hahaha. Saving the eyes for the derby i spose, hahaha
Ya! Not bad for just the second trip this year
Those are some nice fish! Good Job on those whities

Nice fish,  I was fishing this past week and the fish were acting the same way, any movement and they were gone. My Vexilar was solid red about 2’ off the bottom and active all day. That sure makes up for those slow days.  Nice post, look forward to more.
Hard to miss the lakers when you're layin' intonthe pig whiteys!
